fields.summary: Revert HIVE-5700 - enforce single date format for partition column storage

comments.body: Given the scope of the known issues I think we should revert this change. I am sure there are issues which we don't know about.

I didn't see either of these issues on my testing though, DATE_FORMAT should return NULL for invalid values (must be Mysql version/some mode difference), which should cause it to retain value. What version of Postgres was this? Can you run function manually on these values? It's hard to understand how this conversion would happen.

Meanwhile, revert makes sense.
Thank you for the response. I've tested Postgres 8.4.20 and also 9.2.2.0 and the postgres update sql corrupted both of them.

Thank you for the review. I have committed this to trunk.
Hmm, looks like I missed the java part of the change that was not merely code move. Partition spec validation should not have been thrown out... Let me file a JIRA to add it back
[~brocknoland], HIVE-5700 is stated to be "fixed" in version 0.13.  Above, this HIVE-9445 is stated to be fixed in version 0.15.  Was the problem also reverted in 0.13 and 0.14 branches?  Thanks.
[~thejas] [~vikram.dixit] - I believe you guys RM those two branches. Would you apply this change to them?
Was this checked in to 0.13 and 0.14 branches?

This has not been checked into 0.13, 0.14 and 1.0 . [~rhbutani], [~vikram.dixit] if you don't have any objections, I will go ahead and backport them. I also talked to [~sershe] and he recommends that.
Thank you. That would be great! +1 for 1.0.
Can you please also include HIVE-9509, which reverts part of this revert not related to faulty scripts
Merged this and HIVE-9509 branch-1.0 as well.
